2004-2008 2007 - 2008 <<<<<<< HEAD Samantha L. Lyon, Smith College Class of 2008, was a campus activist and a co-founder of the college Bicycle Kitchen. The collection consists of artifacts, audiovisual materials, class notebooks, exams, and papers from courses taken by Samantha Lyon, correspondence, as well as materials documenting her role in founding the Bicycle Kitchen and other activism.
archdesc.bioghist:
Biographical / Historical
Samantha L. Lyon was a member of the Smith College Class of 2008. As a Smith undergraduate, Lyon was committed to promoting bicycles as an environmentally responsible form of transportation and as an enjoyable pastime on campus. Along with fellow activists on campus she started a group called the "Bicycle Kitchen," which invites other bike lovers and riders to learn about bikes, safety, maintenance and benefits. ======= The collection consists of artifacts, audiovisual materials, class notebooks, exams, and papers from courses taken by Samantha Lyon, correspondence, and various ephemera.
Biographical / Historical
Samantha L. Lyon, Class of 2008 >>>>>>> 9513965d9df0c493d3fef1502b8c9358307d0a22
Scope and Contents
The collection contains materials describing the activities of Samantha Lyon including materials from courses and extracurricular activities. Specific material pertaining the founding of Smith College's Bicycle Kitchen and its incorporation with the Student Government Association as well as materials related to Ms. Lyon's "Documenting Oral Histories: Activism at Smith" research thesis. Types of materials include photographs, invitations, newspaper clippings, programs, letters, and DVDs.
Conditions Governing Access
This collection is open for use with following restrictions on access: Some restrictions apply to the oral history interviews.
Conditions Governing Use
Smith College retains copyright of materials created as part of its business operations; however, copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For instances which may regard materials in the collection not created by Smith College, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.
Preferred Citation <<<<<<< HEAD
Samantha Lyon papers, Smith College Archives, CA-MS-00366, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Massachusetts. =======
Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Samantha Lyon Papers, Smith College Archives, CA-MS-00366, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Massachusetts. >>>>>>> 9513965d9df0c493d3fef1502b8c9358307d0a22
Immediate Source of Acquisition
The papers of Samantha Lyon were donated to the College Archives by Samantha Lyon in 2014.
Processing Information
Processed by Elizabeth Carron, Archives Specialist in September, 2014.
